XuBo Zou, K. Pahlke and W. Mathis

Appelstr. 9A, 30167 Hannover, Germany
Abstract

We present a scheme to generate arbitrary superposition of the Fock
states in a high-Q cavity . This proposal is based on a sequence of laser
pulses, which are tuned appropriately to control transitions on Fock state.
It is shown that N laser pulses are needed to generate a pure state with a
phonon number limit N. PACS number(s): 03.67.-a, 03.67.Hk.
The generation of nonclassical states was extensively studied in the past theoretically
and experimentally. The first significant advances were made in quantum optics by
demonstrating antibunched light [1] and squeezed light [2]. A number of scheme has
been proposed for the purpose of generating various special nonclassical state[3]-[19]
in context of cavity QED, trapped ion. In particular, several scheme for generating
arbitrary single mode quantum state[12]-[14] have also been proposed and generalized
to generate arbitrary two mode quantum state[15]-[19]. Experimental realization of
highly nonclassical state, such as Fock states, squeezed and Schrödinger cat states of
one dimensional vibrational motion of a trapped ion and cavity field have been reported
[21, 20]. Among of the above schemes for single mode quantum state preparation

three basic schemes have been proposed. In the schemes proposed by Vogel et al [12],
measurements have to be performed on the atom in order to generate a desired pure
state, which lead to finite probability of success. The probability of detecting atom in
ground state decrease with an increase in the photon numbers. The method described
in Ref[13] is based on the adiabatic transfer of atomic ground state Zeeman coherence,
so that the number of photon is limited by the number of available Zeeman levels. In
Ref[14], a appropriate time-dependent cavity QED interaction is designed to create the
desired field state, which need 2N operations to generate a pure state with a phonon
number limit N. The reduction of the number of operation is important for further
experimental realization. Notice that the quantum state (1) involves N independent
complex coefficients. The purpose of this paper is to present a scheme to generate

the experiment to give control over the cavity field. It is noticed that Kerr nonlinear has

One of the difficulties of our scheme in respect to an experimental demonstration consists in the requirement on the large Kerr coupling coefficient. Recently,two approaches
have been suggested to strongly enhance nonlinearlity- cavity quantum electrodynamics[22]
and electromagnetically induced transparency[23]. These result indicate that giant
Kerr nonlinearlity can beobtained by methods not too far from present technology.
Recently a experiment have been observed that decay time of cavity field is 0.2s[24],
which is a long time enough time to to store field state. We present a scheme to generate arbitrary superposition of the Fock states of the electromagnetic field in high-Q
cavity partially filled by a Kerr medium with a series of coherent pulses injected into
it. This proposal is based on a sequence of laser pulses, which are tuned appropriately
to control transitions on Fock state. It is shown that N laser pulses are needed to
generate a pure state with a phonon number limit N.
